{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fractional lasers work by creating microthermal zones in the skin, which can enhance the absorption of topical drugs. Lidocaine is a topical anesthetic that is often used in dermatological procedures. Therefore, it is plausible that fractional lasers could enhance the transdermal absorption of topical lidocaine in an in vivo animal model.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
